intro: Megalastrum alticola, commonly known as the highland starflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage is evergreen, with narrow, leathery leaves that help it withstand harsh environmental conditions. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are white or pale pink and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
